item.title: Best The Sims 4 Mods To Try In 2025
item.description:
The fact that there won't be a Sims 5 gracing players anytime soon may not be the best news, but that's partly because of the sheer amount of content already released for The Sims 4 . EA is more than happy to support this game for the long haul instead of trying to release yet another brand-new entry that will feel rather barebones, in comparison.

It helps that The Sims 4 is also blessed with a ton of mods, some of which have been released this very year and have generated a ton of downloads and positive fan feedback. From simple additions that improve CAS options all the way to gameplay enhancements, these mods are a great way to spice up one's 2025 playthrough of this game.

Aurum - Agatha Hairstyle

One Of The Most Popular 2025 Mods From A Prolific Creator

  • Mod Link

Aurum is one of the most prolific Sims 4 modders in 2025. Their work is great without going overboard, adding everything from hairstyles to clothing options in the game.

The Agatha Hairstyle mod is one of her more popular 2025 works and gives players a taste of what to expect if they download her creations. Players who become fans of this creator will love downloading more of her work in no time to make their Sims look more unique than ever before.

Cute Romance

Adds More Romantic Interactions In The Game

  • Mod Link

Romance is a huge part of what makes The Sims 4 special, and it's a shame that most modders prefer to release stuff that focuses more on the "adult" side of things, to put it mildly. This is why modders who focus on the purity of romance in the game make it so much fun to play.

With Cute Romance, players can enjoy more organic actions to make their time with a loved one more special than ever. Cuddling someone from behind, slow dancing, and even a new way to propose are a few of the many additions made by this mod.

DivaDesigns Dress 83

A Great Way To Spice Up A Sim's Wardrobe

  • Mod Link

DivaDesigns is another modder who is making waves with their 2025 offerings. This includes numerous clothing options that will make a Sim's wardrobe appear more stylish than ever.

This dress is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to DivaDesigns' content. Once again, players can download this mod to test the waters and check out more of her creations if they vibe with it.

GoldFish Basic Men's Sweater

Good Custom Content For Male Sims Is Always Appreciated

  • Mod Link

The custom content market for The Sims 4 is dominated by female clothing options, which can be rather disheartening for players who want their males to look dapper, too. Thankfully, players will have some good CAS mods to choose from in this regard.

This simple sweater is effortlessly stylish and a natural addition to any Sim's wardrobe. Players will love downloading more modded content from GoldFish to spice up their game if it suits their fancy.

SimsiPhone 2

Makes The Phones In The Game Look Just A Bit More Varied

  • Mod Link

It speaks volumes about how passionate people are about The Sims that something as simple as a phone has been customized by fans to kingdom come. This can be seen in the SimsiPhone 2 mod, which lets players enjoy a suite of designs for their phone.

It's a simple yet great way to enrich the game world and make its visuals more varied. If players are tired of seeing the same phone model over and over again, then this piece of custom content is perfect for them.

Aurum - Maxis Match Denim Shorts

Players Can Enjoy A Great Look With This Modded Outfit

  • Mod Link

Even a simple piece of clothing can do wonders for The Sims 4 's variety if players find the vanilla collection to be stagnant. This is why clothing mods are so rampant in the game.

Creators like Aurum are ensuring that players can enjoy even more clothing options to deck out their Sim in. These denim shorts can do a great job of enhancing the casual wear of a Sim and are far from the only clothing mods players will download if this kind of custom content suits their fancy.

Premade Sim And Relationship Overhaul

Ensures That A New Game Feels Fresh And Engaging

  • Mod Link

Starting a new save and having to witness the same premade Sims with the same relationships over and over again can be grating. A slightly randomized approach that adds more variety to the game can do a great job of making new playthroughs feel fresh.

This is accomplished with a simple overhaul mod that updates the looks of the premade Sims and changes up their relationships in each new save. It does a great job of giving players another excuse to check out another save after investing hundreds of hours (if not more) in the game.

Fortnite Shoes Modpack

Adds Footwear From One Of The Most Popular Modern Games To The Sims 4

  • Mod Link

Fortnite , just like The Sims 4 , is a game that is very popular and has a ton of dedicated players. With this mod, people will be enjoying the crossover they never knew they needed.

Grabbing some of the many stylish pieces of footwear across various Fortnite shoes modpacks and decking out a Sim's wardrobe will feel great. People can turn their Sims into sneakerheads by helping them expand their collection to ridiculous levels.

77
8.2 /10
7 /10

The Sims 4

item.title: 2026 is Suddenly Huge Not Just For Pokemon Games, But Pokemon Clones, Too
item.description:
Pokemon fans may be getting ready to play Pokemon Legends: Z-A next month, but they should also prepare for 2026 as the year starts to wrap up. 2026 marks Pokemon 's 30th anniversary, and players already have plenty of important releases to look forward to outside the milestone's celebrations. Of course, Pokemon has been a franchise that delivers consistently year-to-year, be it with full game releases, merchandise, anime, or any of the multitude of options at The Pokemon Company's disposal. However, anniversary years are special. The last two saw initiatives that widened the scope to where the 25th anniversary was celebrated all year, and the 30th anniversary will likely be just as busy.

Depending on what The Pokemon Company does in 2026, its loyal fans could have their hands full of all sorts of things to do, but that won't be the only thing taking up their schedule. Outside of Pokemon , other prominent releases should catch the eye of fans who adore the monster-catching and raising RPG. There are two, technically three, big releases currently slated for 2026 that aim to bring Pokemon fans into their world by featuring similar mechanics. If players are interested, then their schedule might double or triple for the year. It'll be hard to keep track of if everything pans out as the year starts. Luckily, such a packed schedule means there's something for almost every fan imaginable.

Everything Pokemon Fans Have to Look Forward to From the Series or Otherwise

What Pokemon Could Potentially Do For Its 30th and Similar Games Releasing in 2026

  • Pokemon 30th Anniversary promotions, which will lead to all sorts of merchandise and projects throughout the year.
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's Mega Dimension DLC, with a rumor circulating that Mega Dimension isn't the only DLC the game is getting.
  • Pokemon Champions is set to release, which will change competitive VCG Pokemon completely just in time for the World Championships.
  • The anniversary date in February will likely mark the reveal of the Generation 10 games with a release date of November 2026.
  • If true, Generation 10 will bring in even more merchandise, trading cards, and plenty more items for the collectors of the series to enjoy.
  • Pokemon Pokopia is set to launch in 2026, marking the series' first foray into life sim games.
  • Palworld will be leaving early access and releasing its 1.0 version next year, with tons of content along with it.
  • There's a chance HoYoVerse will release Honkai: Nexus Anima next year.
  • Aniimo is set to launch in 2026 as well, bringing an entirely new creature-catching experience to PC, console, and mobile.

Now, it's worth mentioning that the list above includes a fair bit of reasonable speculation. In terms of Pokemon , it's not unreasonable to think that Generation 10 could be out next year, considering The Pokemon Company's track record with celebrating anniversaries and the franchise's usual production schedule. On top of that, even though the second unannounced Pokemon Legends: Z-A DLC is based on a rumor, it makes sense with how Sword and Shield and Scarlet and Violet got two expansions each. The idea isn't out of the ordinary for the Pokemon series.

If Generation 10 is released next year, potentially after Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's second DLC, then Champions and Pokopia thrown into the mix will leave players with no shortage of titles to play. If competitive play or life simulation games aren't a player's cup of tea, then Aniimo , Honkai: Nexus Anima , and Palworld may have something to offer players in between Pokemon games.

Palworld and Aniimo have announced a 2026 release, but Honkai: Nexus Anima 's release date is unconfirmed.

Even if the next HoYoVerse title isn't released next year, 2026 still seems to be the year of creature-catching games, as fans will certainly be up to their ears in content. Those wanting to try everything in the genre that 2026 has to offer should certainly make sure their schedule is cleared to make it all fit, as there's likely more surprises to come before and after the year begins.

51
8.1 /10
6 /10

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet

item.title: Silent Hill f: How to Claim Deluxe Edition Content
item.description:
Konami has a history of making their games have a Deluxe Edition that includes early access for a set number of hours. While this is a great addition, this is not the only thing that players can get when they preorder the Deluxe for Silent Hill f . There is a costume and some other items, all of which can be accessed fairly early on in the game.

The guide below offers information on what players need to do and how much they will have to progress in order to get the Deluxe Edition contents in Silent Hill f .

How to Claim Deluxe Edition Content in Silent Hill f

As soon as you boot up the game, you can start a new game, where you will find difficulty options for both Action and Puzzles . Do remember that whatever difficulty you choose cannot be changed, so you will have to restart your playthrough if you want an easier playthrough. After the difficulty settings, if you have the Deluxe Edition and have preordered the game, you will get one of three costume options to choose from:

  • Navy Sailor School Uniform
  • White Sailor School Uniform
  • Pink Rabbit Costume

With the outfits out of the way, you still have some stuff from the Deluxe left to claim, and for that, you will have to play through the game. The description of the items when you preordered the Deluxe Edition said that the items would be available in the Hokora . Even though this statement is true, you will not get the items from the first Hokora you pray to, which is right after the opening cutscene. You will have to go through the prologue of the game and past your first few enemy encounters . After this, you will find another Hokora, and this time, you can navigate over to the Bonuses tab to get the following items:

  • Omamori [Peony] - Slightly restores Health upon picking up food items
  • Shriveled Abura-age - A type of Offering. Yields a great deal of Faith when enshrined.
  • Divine Water - Fully restores current Max Sanity and reduces Sanity damage taken for a set time. Can be used as an Offering.
  • First Aid Kit - Fully restores Health.

With the items in your inventory, you can use them if you want or even offer some of them at the Enshrine to get Faith, which is used to draw a random Omamori or for the character upgrades later on in the game.

10 /10

Silent Hill f

item.title: Grow a Garden: All Pets & What They Do
item.description:
Grow a Garden has given players a super-cozy and chill Roblox experience that’s charmed them from the start. But farming can get a little too quiet without some company, especially if you don’t have many in-game friends. Thankfully, the 1.04.0 update introduced pets as sidekicks, making the game a lot more fun and heartwarming.

While these little creatures brighten up your farm and bring it to life, they also support you in many incredible ways. For those interested, this guide will give you a detailed rundown of all Grow a Garden pets and their abilities.

Updated on September 22, 2025, by Somiya Adrees: With each Grow a Garden update, new critters join the ever-growing pet lineup. This guide has been updated to include all pets added up to the 1.24.0 update. New sections have also been added, covering how to collect pets and improve their performance.

How to Get Pets in Grow a Garden

Players can collect so many adorable pets in the game, though only 60 of them can be stored at a time (unless you’ve bought extra pet storage), and just a few can be actively used on the farm. The main way to get pets in Grow a Garden is by opening Pet Eggs, which are available through Pet Eggs shop, Traveling Merchants, and special event shops.

If you're new, Pet Eggs stall is located near the Gear Shop. There, you can purchase six types of eggs, each hatching pets of different rarities. Just keep in mind that only three random types are stocked at any given time.

Pet Eggs

Pets Rarity

Cost

Hatch Time

How to Get Them?

Common Egg

Common

50,000 Sheckles

10 minutes

Pet Eggs Shop

Uncommon Egg

Uncommon

150,000 Sheckles

20 minutes

Pet Eggs Shop

Rare Egg

Rare

600,000 Sheckles

2 hours

Pet Eggs Shop

Legendary Egg

Legendary

3,000,000 Sheckles

3 hours

Pet Eggs Shop

Mythical Egg

Mythical

8,000,000 Sheckles

5 hours, 7 minutes

Pet Eggs Shop

Bug Egg

Divine

50,000,000 Sheckles

8 hours

Pet Eggs Shop

Bee Egg

Mythical

18 Honey Jars

4 hours and 10 minutes

Honey Traveling Merchant

Common Summer Egg

Common

1,000,000 Sheckles

20 minutes

Summer Seed Merchant

Rare Summer Egg

Rare

25,000,000 Sheckles

4 hours

Summer Seed Merchant

Paradise Egg

Mythical

50,000,000 Sheckles

6 hours and 40 minutes

Summer Seed Merchant

While the aforementioned eggs can be obtained easily, event-exclusive eggs, like the Oasis Egg, Primal Egg or Zen Egg, only show up during events. You can grab them from event shops or sometimes in the Game Shop. With the new crafting mechanic, players can also create an Anti Bee Egg at the Crafting Table using resources. Once you have an egg, simply place it in your garden and wait for it to hatch. If you’re in a hurry, you can speed things up using Robux or pets that help hatch eggs faster.

Remember, the devs often give out free new pets, like the Chicken Zombie, Football or Lemon Lion, to players who attend the live launch of the latest updates, so try not to miss them.

What Do Pets Do in Grow a Garden?

Pets in GaG aren’t your average buddies you feed and care for to get good vibes. They do real work for you, like bringing free seeds, gear, mutation tools, Sheckles, and a lot more. There are seven rarities of animals in the game, with the unique ones offering better perks. Here's a breakdown of all the critters and their individual traits in the game.

All Common Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Common Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Robin

Makes your avatar 15 to 20% shorter . Stacking the effect can make you extremely tiny.

55% from the Fall Egg

Chipmunk

Gives a 6.35% chance to not use up a Harvest Tool charge .

None (Obtainable from the Fall Market)

Bunny

Eats a carrot (normal or chocolate variant) and increases its selling value by 1.5x or more when it ages.

33.33% from the Common Egg

Dog

Tries to dig up a seed from your garden (Seed Shop ones) every minute. The seed isn't guaranteed, though, with a success rate of 5.14%.

33.33% from the Common Egg

Golden Lab

Works like the Dog but has a better shot at finding a seed , with a success rate of about 10%.

33.33% from the Common Egg

Starfish

Wanders in the garden and gains 6.36 experience points , making it grow older. Best for opening pet slots.

50% from the Common Summer Egg

Crab

Walks up to another player on the server every 6.12 minutes and pinches them to snag around 260 to 460 Sheckles . They don’t lose any money.

25% from the Common Summer Egg

Seagull

There’s a 4% chance to get a free seed during Lucky Harvest, with the effect capping at 12%.

25% from the Common Summer Egg

Bagel Bunny

Works like a normal bunny but increases your carrot's value by 5x by eating it every 4 to 45 seconds.

50% from the Gourmet Egg

Dairy Cow

Your planted crops grow 1.28x faster within 10.23 studs. Selling this critter has a small chance to reward you with a Beanstalk Seed .

50% from the Sprout Egg

Ladybug

When it’s roaming in your garden, all flower-type crops grow faster and might even get bigger.

50% from the Enchanted Egg

Cardinal

Enables you to grow magic crops (such as Sunbulbs, Spirit Flower, Wispwing, Aurora Vine, Pixie Faern, and more) 1.55x quicker.

34.5% from the Enchanted Chest

All Uncommon Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Uncommon Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Salmon

It receives 4.16 XP every second if a Salmon is active in your garden. If you have more Salmons, it receives experience points from each one individually.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Shop)

Elk

Grants all berry-type fruits , such as Strawberry, Celestiberry, and Cranberry, a 2% chance to remain on the plant after being picked.

34.5% from the Skyroot Chest

Black Bunny

Raises the price of carrots (or chocolate carrots) by 1.53 times when consumed, doing it just a bit sooner than a regular bunny.

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Cat

Naps for 10.12 seconds every 1 minute and 20 seconds, making nearby fruits (within 10.12 studs) grow 1.25x bigger .

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Chicken

Increases egg hatch speed by 10.36%.

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Deer

Has a 2.53% chance of making berry fruits stay on the plant even after harvesting. Berry fruits include Celestiberry, Strawberry, Blueberry, Cranberry, and Raspberry.

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Bee

Goes to a random fruit or veggie every 24 minutes and 45 seconds and makes it Pollinated .

65% from the Bee Egg

Shiba Inu

Finds a seed every minute with a 15% chance; its ability improves with age.

40% from the Zen Egg

Maneki-neko

Gives you an 8.15% chance to refund your sold fruits every 2.22 minutes. The cat’s trait lasts only 10.25 seconds, and the odds are even lower for rare fruits.

None (Obtainable from the Zen Shop)

Bacon Pig

A nice swap for the Pig; it gives about 2.01x better chances for Gold and Rainbow variants every two minutes in a 15.20-stud range.

34.5% from the Culinarian Chest

Sunny-Side Chicken

Always sits on an egg and shortens hatching time by 20.22%.

None (Obtainable from the Rat Connoisseur's Rewards)

Jackalope

Thumps its feet every 99.48 seconds, forcing the Sandy mutation (3x value) on a nearby plant (15.52% chance).

31% from the Sprout Egg

All Rare Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Rare Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Woodpecker

Pecks at a woody plant for 30.57 seconds every 1.59 minutes, with a 6.05% chance to duplicate it. Rare fruits have a lower chance.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Shop)

Badger

Digs and disturbs the ground every 5.06 minutes, giving fruits within 20.45 studs a chance to absorb the Cracked Mutation (4x multiplier) . The chance isn’t guaranteed; it’s 10.18%.

32.5% from the Enchanted Egg

Red Squirrel

When Fall-type pets (from Fall Eggs or Fall Market) finish their abilities, their cooldown resets by 14.4 seconds.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Market)

Pixie

Spreads Pixie Dust in a 15.37-stud range for 15.07 seconds, making crops mature 30 seconds faster each second. It can also trigger a MoonCat-like circle; jumping in lets you and other players float on the server.

29% from the Enchanted Egg

Orange Tabby

A better version of the cat. It sleeps for about 1.30 minutes and makes fruits within 15.16 studs become larger by 1.51% during that time.

33.33% from the Rare Egg

Spotted Deer

Like the deer’s trait, but boosts the chance of berry fruits remaining on the plant after picking to around 5.10%.

16.67% from the Rare Egg

Rooster

Raises egg hatch speed by 20.93%.

10% from the Rare Egg

Pig

Has a chance to turn nearby fruits within 15 studs into Gold and Rainbow variants . The likelihood of this occurring is just 2.02%, and the ability lasts for only 15.35 seconds every two minutes.

25% from the Rare Egg

Monkey

Refunds fruits when selling (only 2.55% likelihood). Rare fruits like Beanstalk, Candy Blossom, Moon Mango, and more have a small chance of a return.

4% from the Rare Egg

Kiwi

Finds and sits on the egg with the highest hatch time every minute, reducing its hatch time by 20.24%.

None (Obtainable by completing Lunar Quest)

Hedgehog

Makes prickly fruits 1.52 times larger. In Grow a Garden , prickly fruits include Cactus, Durian, Dragon Fruit, and Pineapple.

47% from the Night Egg

Honey Bee

Triggers the Pollinated mutation on plants every 19.43 minutes.

25% from the Bee Egg

Wasp

Turns a random fruit Pollinated every 29.46 minutes, then bites and raises an active pet's cooldown by almost a minute every 9.58 minutes.

55% from the Anti Bee Egg

Flamingo

Increases crop growth speed (both seeds and fully grown) for about 15 minutes by standing on a leg every 3.57 minutes. Its ability only affects crops within a range of 13.45 studs.

30% from the Rare Summer Egg

Toucan

Turns your tropical plants bigger and gives them a mutation within a 25.77-stud range. The chances are 1.70x for size and 1.18x for mutation. In Grow a Garden , Tropical plants include Coconut, Mango, Dragon Fruit, Watermelon, Cacao, and more.

25% from the Rare Summer Egg

Sea Turtle

Waters a fruit every 1.97 minutes, giving it a 10.10% chance of transforming into a Wet variant (2x value). Also helps age a random pet every 10.52 minutes, granting it 1,004.77 EXP.

20% from the Rare Summer Egg

Orangutan

Useful for crafting sprays, seeds, sprinklers, and other tools, as it gives you a small chance to get some crafting materials back in your backpack once activated.

15% from the Rare Summer Egg

Seal

When you sell a pet, there's a 2.24% chance you'll get its egg back in your inventory. For example, selling a Mouse might give you a Mythical Egg.

10% from the Rare Summer Egg

Nihonzaru

Once you place a Hot Spring in your garden, this pet will bathe in it and just relax . It doesn’t do anything else.

31% from the Zen Egg

Pancake Mole

Better than a Mole, it digs every 10 to 80 seconds and can pull up all kinds of sprinklers (even Master and Grandmaster), Sheckles, or useful tools like the Recall Wrench, Harvest Tool, Lightning Rod, or Watering Can.

38% from the Gourmet Egg

All Legendary Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Legendary Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Mallard

Every half hour, it flies south and leaves you with a gear reward .

None (Obtainable from the Fall Shop)

Grizzly Bear

This bear has a 10.21% chance to apply Fall Mutation (4x multiplier) on plants every 3.44 minutes. It also increases your avatar size by 8.22%.

10% chance from the Fall Egg

Marmot

Hides in the mound every 2 to 9 minutes, and when caught, gives a reward from the Fall Market . Has a 15 to 30% chance to perform the ability again.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Market)

Shroomie

Helpful in making fungus-type fruits grow jumbo size, as it grants all of them (max 300) within a 15.04-stud radius a 0.005% size bonus . These include Duskpuff, Mushroom, Horned Dinoshroom, Glowshroom, and Nectarshade.

15.4% from the Enchanted Chest

Wisp

Adds 0.75 EXP per second to all active pets as long as a Wisp Well is in your plot.

None (Purchased from the Elder Wisp Caretaker's Fairy Fare Shop)

Imp

This critter will invite you to play by running around the server every 6.66 minutes. Catch it to earn rewards from the Gear and Event Shop . There’s a 10.12% chance it will start the chase again after a successful catch.

15% from the Enchanted Egg

Mandrake

Gives a 3% chance to trigger a Rot Mutation (8x multiplier) on a plant when harvesting the Mandrake crop from your garden.

14.5% from the Skyroot Chest

Gnome

Can mutate a fruit in your plot into the Gnomed variant (15x value) every 9:57 minutes with a 1.05% chance. Each additional Gnome Cosmetic increases the mutation chance by another 1.05%.

None (Obtainable from the Friendship Shop)

Cow

Speeds up the growth of all plants within 8.18 studs by 1.12%, making their fruits spawn faster than usual.

42.55% from the Legendary Egg

Silver Monkey

Can return your fruits and veggies after selling them, but the probability is only 7.76%.

42.55% from the Legendary Egg

Sea Otter

Acts like a living watering can. It sprays water on random plants every 15 seconds, helping their fruits grow faster.

10.64% from the Legendary Egg

Polar Bear

May grant a Chilled or Frozen mutation to random fruits every 1.29 minutes, though the likelihood is just 10.14%.

2.13% from the Legendary Egg

Turtle

Helps sprinklers (Basic, Advanced, Godly, Master, and Chocolate) last 20.47% longer.

2.13% from the Legendary Egg

Panda

Jumps over and eats bamboo , increasing its selling value by 1.57x.

None (Animal Update Pet)

Blood Hedgehog

Makes prickly fruits 2.02% bigger, and any mutated ones among them sell for 1.16% more.

None (Obtainable from the Blood Moon Shop)

Blood Kiwi

Increases both the hatch time and hatch speed of eggs in your garden by 45.56% and 20.25%, respectively.

None (Obtainable from the Blood Moon Shop)

Mole

Around every 1.20 minutes, it digs up gear or Sheckles for you. Gear includes a Trowel, Lightning Rod, Watering Can, all Sprinklers, and anything from the Gear Shop.

23.5% from the Night Egg

Frog

Makes a random crop grow faster for a full 24 hours, meaning its fruits ripen quicker. This ability activates every 19.48 minutes.

17.63% from the Night Egg

Moon Cat

Snoozes for 20.18 seconds every minute and enlarges fruits by 1.51x within a small range. It also helps Moon-type fruits (Moon Mango, Moon Blossom, Moonflower, etc.) stay on the plant after picking.

None (Obtainable from the Twilight Shop)

Firefly

Gives you a Shocked veggie or fruit every 1.32 minutes (3.07% success rate).

None (Test exclusive)

Petal Bee

Not only does it make your flower plants not disappear after picking (1.13% chance), but it also gives a crop the Pollinated mutation after a round of 24.49 minutes.

4% from the Bee Egg

Tarantula Hawk

Works like a Wasp, but quicker. This hawk can mutate a plant in 24.39 minutes and improves cooldown by 82.01 seconds.

30% from the Anti Bee Egg

Moth

Fills the Hunger Bar of an active pet completely every 12.55 minutes.

13.75 from the Anti Bee Egg

Ostrich

Gives newly hatched critters an age bonus , starting them anywhere between 1 and 4.49.

40% from the Paradise Egg

Peacock

Fans its beautiful feathers to reduce the cooldown of pets hanging around it by 60.78 seconds every 9.58 minutes.

30% from the Paradise Egg

Capybara

Nearby pets (within 15.65 studs) won’t lose hunger and build up 3.65 experience points every second.

21% from the Paradise Egg

Scarlet Macaw

Has a 15.95% chance of mutating your fruit into a Verdant variant (4x value) every 11.50 minutes.

8% from the Paradise Egg

Meerkat

Checks out a pet in your garden and reduces its ability cooldow n by 21.08 seconds every 7.14 minutes. There’s also a 15.54% chance it will do it again right after.

45% from the Oasis Egg

Sand Snake

Lets you snag an extra seed or tool when buying one from the Seed Shop or Gear Shop.

34.5% from the Oasis Egg

Bald Eagle

This eagle speeds up the hatching time of all eggs in your garden by 70 seconds every 7 minutes. There's a 70% chance it doubles that, making the hatch time go faster by around 140 seconds instead.

None (Obtainable from the 4th of July Shop)

Raptor

Can magically give your picked fruits the Amber Mutation (10x Multiplier) with only a 2.28% probability. But if your harvested plants are rare, the chance is even lower. Also, it makes you walk faster by 14.35% on the server.

35% from the Dinosaur Egg

Triceratops

Increases the growth of three plants every 3.33 minutes by 33.33 milliliters. You have a 15.18% chance it might do the same for three more plants.

32.5% from the Dinosaur Egg

Stegosaurus

Blesses you with a 9.13% chance for your harvested fruits to be duplicated . Common fruits like strawberries and blueberries easily double, but rare ones like Sunflower, Elephant Egg, and Beanstalk might not be an easy catch. If you try grabbing Prehistoric fruits like the Ancient Seed Pack ones, or even Burning Bud or Bone Blossom, those have a higher likelihood of doubling.

28% from the Dinosaur Egg

Pterodactyl

Gives between three and four fruits the Windstruck Mutation (2x Multiplier) every 10.54 minutes. If you’re lucky, one of your fruits also gets the Twisted Mutation (5x Multiplier), though the chance is just 18.68%. Also increases your jump height by 14.48%.

3% from the Dinosaur Egg

Parasaurolophus

Cuts down 81.21 seconds from the Cosmetic Crate with the longest timer every 1 minute 18.71 seconds. There's a 25.96% chance that it shortens the opening time even more.

35% from the Primal Egg

Iguanodon

All Dino pets (especially from Dinosaur Egg and Primal Egg) walking around your farm earn 0.45 XP per second .

32.5% from the Primal Egg

Pachycephalosaurus

There's a 6.52% chance you'll get a duplicate item while crafting at the Crafting Tables.

28% from the Primal Egg

Tanuki

Causes drama in your garden by occasionally turning your fruits into Choc (2x), Chilled (2x), Moonlit (2x), Bloodlit (5x), or other versions; and also increasing your money, its own XP, or other pets’ passives.

20.82% from the Zen Egg

Tanchozuru

Meditates for 10.22 seconds every 10.24 minutes, giving nearby crops a 15.11% chance to gain the Tranquil Mutation .

4.6% from the Zen Egg

Football

Every 87 seconds, it runs to either the Gear Shop or the Seec Shop (whichever is farther from your plot) to bring you a Watering Can (20.40% chance) or 870 Sheckles.

None (Corrupted Update Pet)

Kodama

Blesses your Zen fruits (including Zen Seed Packs) with a 4.26% chance to gain a Tranquil mutation (20x) after being harvested from the plant.

Kitsune Chest

Corrupted Kodama

This pet has a 4.22% chance to turn your fruits into Corrupted fruits (20x), which are needed for the Corrupted quest.

None (Obtainable by completing the Corrupted Quest)

Sushi Bear

Can apply Frozen (10x value) or Chilled (2x value) mutations to plants every 10 to 80 seconds (with only a 15% chance). It also runs out roughly every 2 to 11 minutes to fill a random pet's hunger bar by 1 to 50%.

7% from the Gourmet Egg

Hotdog Daschund

It’s a food pet that throws either a mustard or ketchup puddle every 3.57 seconds, with a 20.70% chance of boosting cooldown or experience points.

14.5% from the Culinarian Chest

Gorilla Chef

Jumps over a Cooking Pot in the garden, stirs, and cooks to give you duplicate food in your inventory after you finish making meals. You’ll need to place a Cooking Pot to trigger this ability.

None (Obtainable from the Rat Connoisseur's Rewards)

Seedling

It enters one of your plots and picks two plants to swap mutations around every five minutes. The good thing is, it leaves favorited plants alone.

12% from the Sprout Egg

All Mythical Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Mythical Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Sugar Glider

Every 19.53 minutes, it glides over three fruits, copying a mutation from each and applying it to the next. Basically, all three fruits on your farm get an extra mutation from each other.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Market)

Barn Owl

Gives pets bought from the shops a small weight boost (0.01 to 0.24 kg, up to 3 kg) and lets Fall-type pets earn 0.78 XP per second.

1.5% from the Fall Egg

Drake

Breathes under the cooking pot and increases the speed of the meals you’re preparing by 11%. If there’s no pot, he won’t do anything.

None (Purchased from the Elder Wisp Caretaker's Fairy Fare Shop)

Luminous Sprite

Forces the Luminous Mutation (50x value) on nearby fruits every 15 minutes.

None (Fairy Fare Shop)

Glimmering Sprite

Enchants crops with Glimmering Mutation (2x value) about every 8.05 minutes, one at a time.

5% from the Enchanted Egg

Peach Wasp

Turns your fruits into Plasma (5x mutation) every 24:47 minutes and advances the ability cooldown of a random pet by 61.13 seconds every 9:55 minutes.

None (Beanstalk Update Part 2 Pet)

Apple Gazelle

Has a 4.04% chance to harvest double apple-type fruits and a 2.08% chance to apply the Warped Mutation (75x Multiplier) to a random fruit when picking Sugar Apples.

None (Beanstalk Update Part 2 Pet)

Lemon Lion

Forces the Brainrot Mutation (100x value) onto a random fruit by roaring at it every five minutes. Also, every 9:51 minutes it roars again, granting 1552.41 EXP to a random pet.

None (Beanstalk Update Part 2 Pet)

Grey Mouse

Gives the Mouse 521.75 EXP every 10 minutes and boosts players' jump height.

35.71% from the Mythical Egg

Brown Mouse

Allows players to jump higher. Gains 803.74 EXP every eight minutes, aging relatively quickly.

26.79% from the Mythical Egg

Squirrel

Stops a 'Use' from being consumed when using the Reclaimer. Also, it gets experience points every second and ages quickly.

26.79% from the Mythical Egg

Red Giant Ant

With this animal, there’s a 5.16% chance that picking normal fruits (especially berries) gives you an extra one in your inventory.

8.93% from the Mythical Egg

Red Fox

Hops into your neighbor’s garden every 8.57 minutes and tries to grab a seed from any of their non-event plants to bring you. Red Foxes have quite a low success rate if the garden has high-rarity seeds.

1.79% from the Mythical Egg

Caterpillar

Leafy plants within its range produce fruits faster. Leafy plants are those with green leaves, such as Beanstalk, Grape, Eggplant, Pepper, etc.

40% from the Bug Egg

Snail

You might get a seed from the crop you just harvested (5.08% likelihood).

30% from the Bug Egg

Giant Ant

When harvesting crops, there's a 10.38% possibility that they’ll be cloned , giving you two fruits instead of one. Although rare plants are less likely to duplicate, candy fruits are more likely.

25% from the Bug Egg

Echo Frog

Nearly every 15 minutes, one of your crops will experience faster growth for an entire real-world day. The crop will give fruits more rapidly than usual.

8.23% from the Night Egg

Praying Mantis

Prays for 10.30 seconds every 1.32 minutes, increasing your chance of finding a mutated fruit on its radar. You can get any normal mutation except event ones or those triggered by devs (i.e., Plasma and Dawnbound).

4% from the Bug Egg

Owl

All walking critters in your garden gain 0.23 EXP every second. This is helpful in aging them and then selling them to unlock extra pet slots.

None (Obtainable by completing Lunar Quest)

Chicken Zombie

You might get a Zombified fruit every 30 seconds (with only a 20.30% chance). Egg hatch speed also increases by 10.15%.

None (Blood Moon Update Pet)

Hamster

Runs on a hamster wheel every 3.05 minutes and boosts the crafting speed for items you're making at the Crafting Tables by 30.45% for 18.74 seconds.

None (Obtainable from the Summer Shop)

Bear Bee

Grants a nearby fruit, the HoneyGlazed mutation , every 25 minutes.

5% from the Bee Egg

Butterfly

Finds a plant with five or more mutations every 29.56 minutes and replaces all existing variants with the Rainbow mutation . She doesn’t touch favorited plants.

1% from the Anti Bee Egg

Pack Bee

Once placed on your plot, it increases your inventory size by 26.40.

None (Obtainable from the Crafting Tables)

Cooked Owl

Goes to a fruit every 15.01 minutes and can turn it into a Burnt variant (4x multiplier), with a small chance of making it a Cooked variant (25x multiplier). The chance of either mutation is just 15.28%. Additionally, any active pet gains 0.17 EXP on top of what it earns from growing up.

None (Crafting Update Pet)

Mimic Octopus

Copies the ability of an active pet every 20 minutes.

1% from the Paradise Egg

Axolotl

Blesses all your summer fruits (e.g., Pear, Pineapple, Kiwi, Prickly Pear, etc.) with a 6.54% shot at staying on the plant after harvest.

15% from the Oasis Egg

Hyacinth Macaw

Flies around your garden and turns one fruit into the Cloudtouched variant (5x value) roughly every 8 minutes. The variant isn’t guaranteed; it has a 15.74% chance of showing up.

5% from the Oasis Egg

Brontosaurus

This pet has a 5.39% chance to increase the size and weight of your newly hatched pets . However, pets can’t grow more than 30% bigger, even if you use max Brontosauruses. Also, this ability doesn’t affect other Brontosauruses.

1% from the Dinosaur Egg

Dilophosaurus

It spits venom on three random pets, either cutting their cooldown by 40.82 seconds or giving them 570.62 XP , about every 13 minutes 52 seconds.

3% from the Primal Egg

Ankylosaurus

If you have this pet in your garden, there's a 16.35% chance you'll get a stolen fruit back in your backpack, no matter how many mutations it had.

1% from the Primal Egg

Kappa

Hops to a random area and waters fruits within 20.62 studs, applying the Wet mutation (2x value). Other times, it may find a Wet fruit and make it Bloodlit (10.27% chance). Its ability triggers about every eight minutes.

3.5% from the Zen Egg

Koi

Gives players a 0.63% chance for their hatched eggs to return to their backpack . It can come in different colors, but that doesn’t affect its cooldown or trait. Doesn’t work on eggs purchased with Robox (i.e., premium or exotic eggs).

None (Obtainable from the Zen Shop)

Raiju

Eats a fruit with the Shocked mutation and turns four fruits into Static ones (worth 8× value) every 10 minutes and 30 seconds. During Thunderstorms, there's a 20.3% chance your fruits will gain the Shocked mutation instead of Static. If you favorite plants, Raiju will ignore them.

None (Obtainable from the Zen Shop)

Spaghetti Sloth

Applies Cooking Mutations like Pasta (4x value), Meatball (3x value), or Sauce (3x value) to a fruit in your garden every 3 to 14 minutes.

4% from the Gourmet Egg

Mochi Mouse

Helps age your Gourmet Egg pets (or food-type pets) by giving XP every second. It also gains 510 XP itself roughly every 10 minutes.

None (obtainable from Chris P.'s Kitchen rewards)

Junkbot

About every 14.31 minutes, this critter can apply Oil Mutation (15x multiplier), though it only has a 14.72% chance of success.

None (Kitchen Storm Update)

Golem

Walks to the Mutation Machine every 6.35 minutes and cuts 42.42 seconds off the timer.

6% from the Sprout Egg

Spriggan

Spreads its roots within 30.45 studs every 22 minutes, with a 15.23% chance to give one plant the Bloom (8x multiplier) mutation .

None (Obtainable from the Goliath's Goods shop)

All Divine Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Divine Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Red Panda

Restocks one random item in the Gear, Seed, or Pet Shop . If the items are of Mythical, Divine, or Prismatic rarities, they will appear less often. This critter's ability also can't be copied.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Market)

Swan

Visits another player’s farm and befriends a pet to use its ability every 24.46 minutes. Also, it gives a fruit Graceful Mutation every 5.56 minutes.

1% from the Fall Egg

Space Squirrel

Has a 15.36% chance to apply the Voidtouched Mutation (135x value) every 17.54 minutes.

None (Obtainable from the Fall Market)

Phoenix

Mutated critters come out aged 1 to 4 . This pet also flees into your garden every 6:40 minutes and has a 20% chance of triggering the Flaming Mutation (25x value) on four plants.

1% from the Enchanted Chest

Cockatrice

Turns all fruits within its range into Gold (1.21% chance) or Silver (21.04% chance) every 17.45 minutes. It can also spit venom at 7 to 8 fruits, pets, or eggs every 9.12 minutes: fruits hit gain Toxic Mutation (15x value), pets gain 851.48 EXP, and eggs’ hatching time advances by 90.37 seconds.

1% from the Enchanted Egg

Griffin

Releases a Cyclone about every 15 to 20 minutes. If it touches fruits, they have a 10.40% chance to gain the Cyclone Mutation , and if it hits pets, their ability cooldown is reduced by 67.68 seconds.

1% from the Skyroot Chest

Green Bean

Eats a Beanstalk in your garden and increases the size of a random fruit by 5.16x every 29:45 minutes. Its ability can’t be cloned with Mimic Octopus or refreshed with cooldown pets like Queen Bee.

None (Beanstalk Update Part 2 Pet)

Dragonfly

Can turn a random fruit in your garden into gold every 4.5 minutes.

1% from the Bug Egg

Night Owl

Grants 0.23 EXP to all active critters.

3.53% from the Night Egg

Raccoon

Hangs out in your neighbor’s garden every 15 minutes and duplicates a fruit they have for you (even event exclusives).

0.1% from the Night Egg

Queen Bee

Completely refreshes an active pet's trait cooldown every 29.37 minutes and Pollinates one of your garden's plants about every 24.37 minutes.

1% from the Bee Egg

Disco Bee

The first-ever pet that can give your plants the Disco mutation (only a 12.28% chance) every 19.49 minutes

0.25% from the Anti Bee Egg

Blood Owl

All pets roaming your farm earn an extra 0.53 EXP on top of what they get from being fed.

None (Obtainable from the Blood Moon Shop)

Fennec Fox

Hops to another player’s farm every 22.04 minutes, duplicates the most profitable mutation from any plant, then returns and triggers it to one of your fruits.

0.5% from the Oasis Egg

T-Rex

Devours a random mutation from any fruit it likes and spreads that mutation to three or four other fruits, roughly every 20 minutes.

0.5% from the Dinosaur Egg

Spinosaurus

It eats a random mutation from about 4 fruits in your garden, then passes those variants to one random fruit every 19 minutes 33 seconds. It usually goes for your favorited plants first.

0.5% from the Primal Egg

French Fry Ferret

Can age your pets by 1 level every 20 minutes. That said, its trait can't be cloned by Mimic Octopus or reset by Queen Bee or cooldown pets.

1% from the Gourmet Egg

Lobster Thermidor

This pet can give Molten (25x value) or Meteoric (125x value) mutations every 5 to 30 minutes; Molten has a 20% chance, Meteoric has a 10% chance.

1% from the Culinarian Chest

Golden Goose

Lays a golden, Easter egg–like crop every 13 minutes, already sprouting with the Fortune mutation (50x multiplier) . Just like other crops, this Golden Egg plant can be mutated further, then harvested and sold. When sold, it can randomly reapply the Fortune mutation to another plant in your plot.

1% from the Sprout Egg

All Prismatic Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Prismatic Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Kitsune

Enters another player’s farm every 22 minutes and mutates a random fruit with the unique Chakra Mutation (15x value), or sometimes the Foxfire Chakra (90x value), then clones the fruit back to your garden.

0.08% from the Zen Egg

Corrupted Kitsune

Forces nine fruits from your garden to get Corrupt Chakra (15x value) or Corrupt Foxfire Chakra (90x value) every 20:56 minutes. The chance of mutation is just 20.24% for Chakra, while the other one is even rarer.

1% from Kitsune Chest

Can You Improve Pet Traits in Grow a Garden?

You can definitely improve your pet's ability in Grow a Garden by either aging it or giving it Gold and Rainbow mutations . By doing so, they’ll experience a spike in their ability. For example, they'll be able to duplicate fruits more successfully, use their traits more often, and even have a higher likelihood of giving variants or seeds.

To age your pets faster, make sure they’re well-fed and gaining EXP by roaming freely or with the help of EXP-boosting animals. The best part is, just like crops, pets continue to grow while you're offline. You just need to keep an eye on their hunger bar, which decreases every 12 hours. As for Gold and Rainbow mutations, they are luck-based. Just toss a pet (aged 50 or older) into the Pet Mutation machine and hope it comes out like that.

Players can also use the Pet Mutations machine to give pets other powers , like adding mutations to fruits, stopping fruit from getting stolen, or giving experience points to active critters.

Do Pet Abilities Stack in Grow a Garden?

Based on Grow a Garden’s official Discord, pet abilities do stack. This means you can get more from their combined traits. For instance, a Polar Bear only gives a small chance for Chilled or Frozen fruits to spawn on your farm, but having more of these critters can raise your mutation odds. Also, since the Silver Monkey has trouble refunding unique plants, you can leave many of those on your plot if you want to keep your valuable crops even after selling them.

This stacking works for animals with similar traits, too. Having an Owl, Night Owl, and Blood Owl together can give your active pets’ experience points a nice boost. To get the most out of this, try unlocking more pet slots (there are up to eight) and add critters that meet your goals.

448
8.8 /10

Roblox

item.title: Overwatch 2’s Answer to Fortnite Festival Comes with a Massive Asterisk Attached
item.description:
Overwatch 2 is gearing up for a brand-new in-game Music Festival event, featuring bright neon skins, matching dance emotes, an event Battle Pass, and most importantly, a rhythm minigame. This event is unlike any that has ever taken place in Overwatch 2 before, and is evocative of the Fortnite Festival spin-off of the critically-acclaimed battle royale.

However, there is a massive asterisk attached to this event: it is only available to Overwatch 2 fans in China. While aspects of the event are expected to arrive globally, its most unique features will likely only be available to Chinese players. Unfortunately, this massive limitation will prevent Overwatch 2 ’s answer to Fortnite Festival from ever reaching the same levels of excitement.

Fortnite Festival vs. Overwatch 2’s Music Festival

Overwatch 2 Can’t Hold a Candle to Fortnite With This Kind of Event

Fortnite Festival is a robust rhythm game released as a part of the Fortnite launcher in December 2023. Created by Harmonix, the original makers of Guitar Hero and Rock Band , Fortnite Festival is in many ways a spiritual successor to some of the cornerstones of the rhythm game genre.

In the nearly two years since its release, Fortnite Festival has received tons of updates, including guitar controller support, PvP modes, and tons of songs. Ten seasons of tracks themed around various artists have been released over the years, ranging from The Weeknd and Lady Gaga to Hatsune Miku and Gorillaz – the current season of Fortnite Festival .

  • The Weeknd
  • Lady Gaga
  • Billie Eilish
  • Metallica
  • Karol G
  • Snoop Dogg
  • Hatsune Miku
  • Sabrina Carpenter
  • Bruno Mars
  • Gorillaz

Enter the Overwatch 2 Music Festival event. Themed around five Neon Pulse skins for Pharah, Juno, Ashe, Sombra, and Mercy, and their matching dance emotes, the heart of this promotion seems much like similar Overwatch 2 events. However, the addition of an independent event Battle Pass, as well as a Guitar Hero -esque minigame called "Rythymwatch," makes it seem much more like Fortnite Festival , even if it is only available for a limited time.

But unfortunately, this event is only available in China. Though the nation has a massive pool of players in the wake of Blizzard and NetEase bringing Overwatch 2 back to China, it still only accounts for a fraction of the global community. Most fans being unable to experience this new event will not only limit its reach but also stymie its chance of being successful.

Of course, there is a chance some of the aspects of the Overwatch 2 Music Festival event could move outside of China. The skins and emotes, for example, are expected to be released globally, though the in-game events and minigames probably won’t.

That said, as fashionable as these cosmetics are, it is nothing players haven't seen before, such as with the new Persona 5 x Overwatch 2 collab. An event-specific Battle Pass and rhythm minigame, on the other hand, has never been done in Overwatch 2 's history, so it is a bummer to see that it is region-locked.

This isn’t the first time China has gotten a region-locked Overwatch 2 minigame spin-off; the robust Loverwatch dating sim featuring romance routes for Genji, Juno, D.Va, Mauga, Lifeweaver, Junker Queen, and Cassidy was available for CN players back in July.

If Overwatch 2 were to double down on this music festival event, it could actually become real competition for Fortnite Festival . A permanent rhythm game with songs from Overwatch 2 and the various crossover IPs, or even possibly other Blizzard IPs like Diablo , StarCraft , and Warcraft , has the potential to be a massive hit. At the moment, the most players can hope for is that the Chinese-exclusive event is a huge hit, so that it might eventually see a global release.

62
7.3 /10
6 /10

Overwatch 2
